(B) one

(D) three
(E) four
(F) five
(G) six
(H) seven
(I) eight
(J) nine
(K) ten
(L) eleven
(M) twelve
(N) thirteen
(O) fourteen
(P) fifteen
(Q) sixteen
model_outputs.model_answer:
Let's go through this step-by-step:
1. There are initially three grey cat toys. Since we are not removing the cat toys themselves, there will still be three grey cat toys.
2. There are initially two purple cat toys. Since we are removing all the notebooks, which includes two purple notebooks, there will still be two purple cat toys.
3. There are initially two mauve cat toys. Since we are removing all the notebooks, which includes one purple notebook, there will still be two mauve cat toys.
4. There are initially two grey notebooks and two purple notebooks. Since we are removing all the notebooks, this means there will be no grey or purple notebooks remaining.
5. There are initially three grey notebooks. Since we are removing all the notebooks, this means there will be no grey notebooks remaining.
6. There are initially one mauve and two purple notebooks. Since we are removing all the notebooks, this means there will be no mauve or purple notebooks remaining.

Therefore, there will still be two grey objects on the floor when all the notebooks are removed. The answer is (B) one.
